name: Hyatt Regency North Dallas/Richardson

reviews.text: I recently attended a business conference at the Richardson Hotel. I was a little apprehensive to stay at the hotel due to previous reviews, but I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms have been upgraded and include very comfortable beds/bedding. My room had two queen beds and was rather small, but comfort was not an issue as a single traveler. I had no problem with the air or the hot water as mentioned by earlier guests. In fact, the hot water was immediate when switched on which was quite nice. The room that I was in was on the 6th floor and overlooked I-75. Noise was never an issue during my stay.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: The one thing that I found to be a little frustrating was the wireless internet connection. The signal was not very strong and I constantly got knocked off the internet.
reviews.title: Overall, Pretty Good
Richardson Hotel OK if other area hotels are booked
reviews.text: I will definitely stay at the Richardson on m next business trip to the area.

reviews.title: No Hot water no internet
reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights on a business trip. Having read the previous reviews I was somewhat apprehensive , but I was pleasantly surprised. My room was clean and tastefully decorated, if somewhat small. Everything worked as expected ( including air conditioning, luckily since it was 105 degrees outside. ) The hotel staff was professional and courteous.

reviews.title: Reasonable rooms, but can be noisy, bad breakfast.
reviews.text: A few downsides:
From start to finish, this was an exceptional hotel. We are formerly from this area, so really know all the properties. For the money, you can't beat the Richardson Hotel!
reviews.title: 'Luxury' quality at low, low price!

reviews.text: Rooms and bedding rival those luxury hotels. The common areas are well-maintained and finely furnished. Not "tired" like other hotels ... this one seems to really keep pace with routine maintenance like paint, window washing, and all the little details that make it even more enjoyable.
reviews.title: Good Value for the price

reviews.text: Room was spacious and finely furnished, and so clean!
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay and friendly staff

reviews.text: Full service at a budget motel price. It's a deal you can't pass up.
reviews.title: 'OK' Business Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall the hotel seems nice. I checked in very late since my flight was delayed. It took the clerk almost 20 minutes to process my check in, while the other clerk checked in several people during the same time. Room service stopped at 10:00 pm, so I was forced to go out to a fast food place to grab something to eat. There are no mini bars in the room either. Basically if you arrive after 10:00 and are hungry, the hotel can't help you.
reviews.title: Nice Attractive hotel

likes.liked: — The decor, the bedding, the price
likes.disliked: — plumbing, size of the room, surcharges for room service

reviews.title: Working hard to be a Hyatt
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel from the last Thursday in August until Labor Day 2008. At check-in, we were told that it had been taken over by Hyatt in February 2008. Some things are Hyatt, while others are being worked on while the hotel is open and running.

reviews.title: Great Hotel - Top Notch Service - Clean & Comfortable
reviews.text: Example, we had a flat-screen TV, but they didn't have a local Dallas newspaper, let alone the New York Times or Wall Street Journal on Friday.

reviews.title: hate it
reviews.text: The staff was great. The location was great.

reviews.title: Good Stay
reviews.text: When they become a Full Hyatt Regency, it'll be even better.

reviews.title: Very clean
reviews.text: I Travel for a living (spend over 200 nights per year in Hotels) and this is one of the best places I stay. The rooms are clean , the staff is very professional, and the location is extremely convenient to just about anywhere in the Metroplex. After I checked out, I missplaced the copy of my bill & Steve in Accounting emailed me a fesh copy within a minute of me asking.

reviews.title: Decent Hotel
reviews.text: We just returned from staying at The Richardson Hotel in the North Dallas suburb of Richardson. The hotel's location is perfect for business travelers, but it is quite a drive from the attractions in the Dallas area if you're visiting for pleasure.

reviews.title: Great Hotel Great Price
reviews.text: The hotel staff is EXTREMELY FRIENDLY! They were more attentive to me and my well-being than I had expected. The management staff was very responsive to every request, but the only sour grape was the bartender named Nicole. She would not turn on the music in the bar area because two people were eating - there were about 20 other people in the bar just drinking. I guess the atmosphere at the bar wasn't that great with the lack of music and the extremely bright lights.

reviews.title: Nice place!
reviews.text: The lobby is welcoming and the shuttle service is great if you don't have a car and want to travel to a place close to the hotel. The elevators can take a while though.

reviews.title: Solid 3 star
reviews.text: The rooms were comfortable overall. We had a view that faced the highway, but the windows were thick enough we didn't hear the traffic. The beds were comfy, and the bathroom amenities were decent. The only complaint I have about the room is the decor because the walls are pretty bare. But we just needed a place to sleep, so it was sufficient.

reviews.title: Great stay at the Richardson
reviews.text: The outdoor pool looked inviting with the 80-degree weather in November! And the gym looked pretty cool.

aka: Hyatt Regency North Dallas/Richardson Hotel Richardson
